meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for sale or trade.
meanings.sent1: The merchantability of the goods ensured they would sell quickly.
meanings.sent2: The merchantability of the new product made it a hit in the market.
meanings.sent3: The comical merchantability of the quirky invention surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a merchantability that attracted customers like bees to honey.
meanings.sent5: The bright packaging enhanced the merchantability of the items on display.

meanings.definition: The ability of a product to be sold or marketed successfully.
meanings.sent1: The company's success was due to the high merchantability of their products.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the target audience is crucial for the merchantability of a product.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected merchantability of the old stock brought a smile to the owner's face.
meanings.sent4: His charm added a unique merchantability to the brand, setting it apart from competitors.
meanings.sent5: The catchy jingle contributed to the merchantability of the advertisement.
